info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 26 at 2:25PM EST until December 27 at 6:00AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive runoff continues. * WHERE...A portion of western North Carolina, including the following county, Rutherford. * WHEN...Until 600 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 223 PM EST, Please remain wary of out of bank or elevated conditions along the Rocky Broad River downstream of Lake Lure this afternoon. Interests should continue to monitor rising levels along the Second Broad River as well. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Forest City, Rutherfordton, Spindale, Bostic, Alexander Mills, Union Mills, Green Hill, Thermal City, Shingle Hollow and Sunshine. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding or landslides threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed.
